thread.title: Antonio Brown, Steelers Agree on New Contract: Latest Details and Reaction
thread.title_full: Antonio Brown, Steelers Agree on New Contract: Latest Details and Reaction

author: Joseph Zucker
title: Antonio Brown, Steelers Agree on New Contract: Latest Details and Reaction
text: According to NFL Network's Ian Rapoport , the contract will be worth more than $15 million annually, and Schefter provided a breakdown of the deal: Adam Schefter @AdamSchefter Antonio Brown deal: 4-year extension worth $68 million - 17M per year over 4 years, and $18.5M over 3 years. Tied to Steelers through 2021. 2/27/2017, 10:32:37 PM It's not as if Brown's future was ever in major doubt. He still had one year left on his previous deal, which would have paid him a little over $13.6 million in 2017, and neither the Steelers nor Brown had much reason to want a separation. Brown was named to his fourth straight Pro Bowl in 2016, and he earned first-team All-Pro honors for the third year in a row. By his incredibly high standards, the 28-year-old had a somewhat disappointing 2016 campaign. His 106 receptions and 1,284 receiving yards were his lowest totals since 2012, but his 12 touchdowns marked the second-highest tally of his career. Football Outsiders ranked Brown as the No. 7 wideout in defense-adjusted yards above replacement in 2016, and Pro Football Focus graded him third at the position. Since entering the league as a sixth-round draft pick out of Central Michigan in 2010, Brown has gone from relative obscurity to one of the league's best wideouts. Here are his position rankings during that time, per Pro-Football-Reference.com : Antonio Brown By the Numbers Games
